title: Will Riot actually read this sub-community?
body: Test Post: I think we should delete Teemo.

replies.body:
YES. WE WILL.

(read the posts, not delete Teemo, unfortunately)

Completely unrelated, but @IronStylus I wanted to let you know that Riot's art department lately has helped me get so many women into gaming by giving me more and more examples of non-stereotypical female character art in video games. Please keep up the good work, you're awesome.
(You should probably delete this post.  This isn't a boys club and you represent Riot.)
@Zerglinator, nah, slifty's right. It's in poor taste. Deleted.

Of course :)

And I expressed mine by hinting that frat-level comments that imply women are things to collect are.. well.. inappropriate in a setting that *ought* to treat women as actual people, not coins or trading cards.

Also it seems reasonable that he should be held to a much, much higher standard as a red. <-- that is the only reason I suggested deletion.  I just didn't really want to escalate it into a public lambasting of a riot rep.

Whoops!
He's allowed to speak his mind and voice his opinion.

Glad she feels that way! Again, we don't want to be like.. LET'S COVER ALL THE GIRLS to cater, we just want to make the most awesome thing, and however it fits the character, is how it'll pan out in terms of archetype, whatever the gender or species is. It's about what's right in context, not designing with an agenda. 

That said, I'm really glad she feels we're moving towards more variety!
I'd like you to know that I buy every new skin/champ that comes out if it's a woman who is wearing modest clothing. I'm glad to see that we're getting more variety.

You misread the plural as a singular! 

And I didn't really mean to imply that you guys have a hidden agenda; it's just been really refreshing to see diverse characters that break out of the somewhat white-male catering molds that most video games adhere to. 

I know that character design is a huge group effort at riot, but you've touched on gender a bit on the forum with regards to the Sejuani steel bikini, and I wanted to reach out and give some positive feedback to you personally for that. Thanks again :)

Just to push back a little -- I look at the cast of characters and see a LOT of large breasted, beautiful faced women showing skin; not so many men who are attractive in any comparable way.  This trend has also continued with newer champions.  I'm sure RIOT has commented on it somewhere, but I'd love to hear their thoughts here and now.

I want the gaming world to be a place that I can unapologetically send my future daughter to explore.  I'm guessing it will take many years to change the culture and attitude towards women by gamer communities -- it may never happen -- but I feel like companies like RIOT are in a pretty powerful position to be able to set the tone.

We're definitely not there yet, I completely agree. That said, I think Riot is one of the better studios in the industry. Is that a low bar to meet? Yes. Could Riot be doing a whole lot better? Yes. I have hopes for the future though.
Parrot? In MY threads?

Hey IronStylus, how do you and the art team feel about the icons and number of icons you have released, do you feel that with this new type of forum that shows off our icons, that would be a big place to improve, or open up the creativity of the players.

I wasnt one of the people using the HTML but I know so many people who did, and I feel it really shows how players want to really customize and make themslves unique. How would you feel about something akin to the halo icons where people can mix and match the icons they have available to make something unique. 

I know i spent more time than i care to admit just trying to make something that meshed really well out of a bunch of random icons.
Why did they even do this, Reddit's League of Legends subreddit is already the biggest gaming subreddit, This is literally just a downs version of it.
Oh, yes. Yes, indeed.
Shut up, BrokenSword.
Looks like a side effect of that Sword breaking was Multiple Personality Dis-Sword-er.
PUNS OF DAMAGE!!!
It was the hilt (me), talking to the blade.
Whatever, nerd. You can't HANDLE this.
Teemo OP
